entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 07 at 10:49PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 70 below occuring. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range Passes.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 11:35PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Icy Spots Possible... Temperatures below freezing may cause wet surfaces to freeze, causing the possibility of icy spots through early morning. Anyone travelling should allow extra time to get to their destinations.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 6:01AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ICY SPOTS ON AREA ROADS THIS MORNING... With the freezing of standing water on area roads, as well as some patchy freezing fog, there may be some icy spots on area roads this morning. This will be especially true for secondary and untreated roads. Exercise caution when traveling this morning.

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued February 08 at 5:46AM EST until February 08 at 8:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility 1/4 quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Inland Miami-Dade, Metro Miami-Dade, Coastal Miami- Dade and Far South Miami-Dade Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 4:21AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Fog Possible This Morning... Patchy fog will be possible across portions of the area, especially the western Atlantic Metro and interior portions of Southwest Florida through the morning commute. Visibilities are likely to be reduced to around 1 mile at times, with localized areas experiencing reduced visibilities to one-half of a mile.

entry.title: Extreme Fire Danger issued February 08 at 3:26AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...extreme fire danger today... The rangeland fire danger index will be in the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme fire danger means that fires start quickly...spread furiously and burn intensely. All fires are potentially serious. All outdoor burning should be avoided in areas with extreme fire

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 6:48AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY FREEZING FOG AND BLACK ICE THIS MORNING... Motorists over the lower Maryland eastern shore will need to be alert for patchy freezing fog and black ice this morning from yesterday`s rains. Areas of black ice are most likely on bridges, overpasses, and elevated surfaces, mainly along and west of highway 13. Allow for extra time to reach your destination this

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 11:35PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Freezing Drizzle and Light Snow Possible... Patchy freezing drizzle along with light snow is possible along and west of the Allegheny Front in Garrett and western Grant Counties through early morning. Any accumulation will be light, but roads may become slippery as a result. Anyone travelling should allow extra time to get to their destinations.

The following message is transmitted in collaboration with the South Dakota Department of Agriculture and Natural Resources. * WHAT...Northwest winds at 20 to 40 mph with gusts around 60 mph. * WHERE...West of the Gap in Rapid City.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 3:04PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BRIEF FREEZING TEMPERATURES POSSIBLE EARLY TUESDAY MORNING FOR NORTHERN PORTIONS OF SOUTH TEXAS... Clear skies and light winds will allow temperatures to fall into the 30s across south Texas tonight. Some areas in the northern Brush Country and northern Coastal Plains could see readings fall to near or just below freezing for a brief period early Tuesday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bee; Goliad; La Salle; Live Oak; McMullen

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 6:52AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY FREEZING FOG AND BLACK ICE EARLY THIS MORNING... Patchy freezing fog will continue over the next few hours over central Virginia, including the Richmond metro area and the Tri- Cities. Motorists will need to be alert for reduced visibilities due to the fog, as well as slick spots and patches of black ice, especially on untreated surfaces, bridges, and overpasses from

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 11:35PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Icy Spots Possible... Temperatures below freezing may cause wet surfaces to freeze, causing the possibility of icy spots through early morning. Anyone travelling should allow extra time to get to their destinations.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued February 08 at 4:16AM AST until February 09 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet. * WHERE...Beaches of the northwest to northeast Puerto Rico, beaches of Culebra, as well as north and west Saint Thomas. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued February 08 at 4:16AM AST until February 09 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet. * WHERE...Northern and eastern beaches of Saint Croix. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 6:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Slippery Road Conditions Expected This Morning... Scattered snow showers will continue across much of Vermont through the morning hours, with any accumulation an inch or less. However, this will be enough to create slippery travel conditions, especially on untreated roads. Motorists are urged to use caution and remain alert for rapidly changing road conditions.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Eastern Rutland; Essex; Grand Isle; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington; Western Addison; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin; Western Rutland; Windsor

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued February 08 at 1:44AM PST until February 08 at 11:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility less than one quarter of a mile in dense fog. * WHERE...In Washington, Clark County and the Greater Vancouver Area. In Oregon, all of the Willamette Valley, including Portland, Salem and Eugene areas. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PST this morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 11:35PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Freezing Drizzle and Light Snow Possible... Patchy freezing drizzle along with light snow is possible along and west of the Allegheny Front in Garrett and western Grant Counties through early morning. Any accumulation will be light, but roads may become slippery as a result. Anyone travelling should allow extra time to get to their destinations.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued February 08 at 2:53AM MST until February 08 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 65 MPH possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills
